transcript:
heavily, and looked round at the generals. 
"Gentlemen, the dispositions for tomorrow or rather for today, for it is past midnight cannot now be altered," said he. "You have heard them, and we shall all do our duty. But before a battle, there is nothing more impor- tant . . ." he paused, "than to have a good sleep." 
He moved as if to rise. The generals bowed and retired. It was past midnight. Prince An- drew went out.
